Key Arguments: The legislation contradicts the Universal Declaration of Human Rights by violating freedom of thought and speech.
No government should control or direct what individuals think or say.
The bill is seen as a form of mind control that undermines democracy.
Promoting individual thought and debate is essential for progress and prosperity.
The government has previously spread misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19.
The bill appears to protect government narratives and agendas, exempting the government from the rules.
The omission of the word 'truth' in the bill suggests it is not concerned with truthfulness.
The bill is oppressive and designed to silence opposing views.
Main Themes: Historical references to Magna Carta and its principles
Notable Quotes: There is no government body... that has any rights to determine, control, or direct how or what any other human being thinks.
A community that is under this mind control has no democratic base...
The last 3 years has exposed how dangerous the government initiative of labelling important topics as misinformation has been.
This Bill is making it legal for government to spread misinformation!!
NO GOVERNMENT IS ABOVE THE LAW, therefore no government can be given exemption from laws.
